title: Varus being CHANGED to Gay feels wrong for his character
body:
BEFORE PEOPLE GET IN A TIZZY THINKING IM HOMOPHOBIC. DON'T PLAY THAT CARD, LET ME EXPLAIN.

Varus's story is BASED on the fact that he lost his family, his wife and his child. Him having a wife and a child was based on how he gained his ability's. It showed the distance he would go to avenge his family, that was his whole purpose.


Changing him to being gay completely throws characters away from being canon. Your throwing away his wife, and his child. This just does not feel right. It feels like Riot sat down and was like "hey we need a gay character to show diversity. Let's just change one of our character's back story COMPLETELY and make him gay! Fixed!"

Now, if this was a character like, let's be stereo typical, Vi. If she was announced as gay, I would have no problem with it, why? because nothing in her story or lore is based on her sexuality or her choices. If Ryze was announced gay, whatever, he is a protector of a scroll, what does his sexuality have to do with that? Nothing. 

But  Varus's original  story was based on the fact that he lost his wife and child. The depths that he would go to avenge them. Your throwing those characters out for diversity reasons? why couldn't they just release a new champion with Varus's new story? Why did they have to take an established character that no one asked to be changed and just rewrite his story? Because reasons?


I get that they wanted to make him a Darkin, but why could they not just go "He lost his family so he gave himself to a darkin so that he could have the power to avenge them" Simple, easily done.

(braces for public impact and people not reading full post and getting angry)

EDIT: I understand the Varus (the darkin) is not Gay, but the people that inhabit him are. It STILL doesn't change the fact that we are tossing away characters for the sake of "We need a more diverse cast of characters"

EDIT #2: Some people just CANNOT get it through their heads so let my clarify it again. Varus's Old lore was based on the fact that he had a wife and child. They were killed, driving him to gain powers to avenge them. That Varus is now COMPLETELY dead. It was not adjusted or changed. It's been thrown out the window, in a wood chipper and blasted into a fire. Not even the same character anymore. Him being straight was apart of his lore and his defining reason of gaining powers. Why would you take one of the few champions in league that SPECIFY'S that he straight (and it's one of the bases of his character) and retcon him to being gay and throwing out what meant the most to him? They could have simply fleshed out a character where their sexuality means nothing to their story and mentioned "Hey, they are X" and (other then real homophobes) no one would have cared.

Varus was the vengeful husband. A moral grey area that people could relate to. Now he's a murderous machine with 2 gay lovers trying to stop him internally, with the vengeful thought of "kill all humans"

replies.body:
Maybe Varus found out that he's gay and he didn't love his wife and child, and so he murdered them and ran away. Then he came into contact with the Darkin and fell in love with the supposed male Darkin and they joined into 1.

Hehehehehehehehehe

HEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHE

No.

Honestly, the old set up really was pretty good to ring the new Darkin stuff onto. All the stuff you need is already there, you just needed to fill the Darkin's name in and put it somewhere in there, basically.

Why they have to re-write the entire character, I am not too sure.

I mean, despite how much shit people gave for Galio, I actually think it makes perfect sense for the character because the old Galio literally has 0 personality, or rather, having 0 personality WAS his personality; which was very unworkable, hence they had to change it. And for the most part, they did gave him a pretty good characterisation, where his shining smile is just there to hide how trouble he really is, very reminiscent of the old Galio and pretty cool.

But then this... idk, it doesn't seem like it fits really, and seems like a complete waste of who Varus has been and the potential of that story because it was some pretty interesting stuff; sure it was some typical revenge story, but it's the struggle and the allusion of "falling" and "how far are you willing to go to satisfy that thirst for vengeance" was nevertheless a great touch and theme to look at. I really hope they aren't gonna just drop the ball here.

I mean, the name "Varus" is not even referring to the arrow man anymore isn't it. It will take some time getting used to I suppose.
I feel like I'm one of the few people that like both iterations of Galio.

I like both versions too, I just don't fault the lore change because it makes a lot sense to me. Though I do personally prefer the newer one.

To me, it doesn't feel like Riot did it for the sake of diversity. If they had, they would've done it in a much different way. This feels subtle and natural (MUCH better than the way Blizzard did it with Tracer, which felt extremely forced).

**While I agree** that it's strange that they picked a character who was so explicitly straight in the old canon, I also can't complain because of how well this new story was done and the sense that it makes for the new canon. 

I highly doubt that going into this, their first thought was "lets make a gay character" they probably fleshed out the story first, and then ended up choosing a homosexual relationship instead of a straight relationship or a sibling relationship.
When you retcon a previously straight character it does feel forced.

Especially when he was one of the few characters in League of Legends CONFIRMED straight. In most character's cases, sexuality is not addressed because it is not important to their story. Varus was literally one of like half a dozen characters where it WAS relevant.

Except, it doesn't. Forced would be shoving it in our faces, kissing, constantly saying they're gay and so so in love. Boom in your face from the start with no meaning behind it, that's what forced means. Not changing something.
Funny you say that since they constantly kept shoving down our throats how they are in love throughout the comic. It's almost as if Riot hired a bunch of tumblr girls to write this comic.

Except, they're not. it's simply fact that they aren't forcing it, not a matter of opinion.
What you say literally means _ nothing._ Sucks to be you.

Completely delusional and entitled to your own opinions with literally no arguments. Yeah, sure sucks to be me.

I don't mind them being gay but the comic was written poorly. This way it comes off as obviously forced for the sake of diversity and change.

I don't think him being gay is what upsets you. If Varus had a husband and child before giving himself to the darkin, the story would be the exact same save for wife being husband. I think what you're more frustrated with is that the core to Varus's old story was that _he lost his family_. He lost the love of his life and the family they raised together, which broke him and drove him to the point of revenge.

In the new lore, Varus lost his love...buuuuuuuut is then rezzed as a ghost-voice in his head and he now shares the body as a trio. That's the more radical change to Varus's personality. Plus Varus isn't "Varus" alone anymore. He's three people that are all trying to control one body. That's the important change and I think you'd be upset by it no matter if this new Varus was a man and a woman, two women, two men, whatever. It's such a major change to who he originally was that I can understand why you're pissed but I don't think him being gay is the core issue you have with the story.
Hell, I feel like they could have kept Varus' lore the same except he had a husband instead of a wife, and while it would feel forced, it would still feel like the essence of the character remained.

Parents are vastly underrepresented in League, considering more than half of the cast is old enough to have kids (and also is a human that can actually HAVE children). Kassadin I think is the only one, Varus formerly being the other. One thing I really like about Ana of Overwatch, it informs her character but its not the only thing about her character, and serves to make her unique and interesting.
Also Darius: in his comic he finds out the dead son of a Noxian woman was also his son.

I think it's only heavily implied, but I thought it was the girl that kills that chick that was implied to be his daughter? Maybe both, I'll have to reread. 

But yeah, I sorta don't count him because if you weren't aware you were a parent then what's the difference? If we get fatherly stories from Darius in the future then he totally counts. But Kassadin and Varus actually raised their children somewhat.
I liked old lore way better. To me it was Varus' esswnce. They just killed him. Why wouldn't they make another new champion with this lore instead of deleting Varus {{sticker:sg-janna}}
In this day and age is that even a risk anymore?  I mean really, times have already changed significantly.

Perhaps not in western countries (even though some people may disagree), but there are still lots of nations where the concept of homosexuality is a very problematic taboo. LoL is part of the videogame media and a media can be a really powerful tool for cultural change. Sure, it won't be the factor that is going to bring gay acceptance all over the world but it could still help giving homosexuals a better representation, who knows. Personally i don't have a single problem with this narrative choice even though it doesn't cater to me.
The only problem I have with it is the change from the old character to the new.  If this new story was a new character I'd be all for it.

Giving my opinion:

 I am not upset at the thought of Varus being gay(s). I dunno, Varus himself may not be gay but he's got gay(s) inside him (Shit is way too confusing for me. I am a straight white man I have no opinion)

Firstly, As a husband and a father, the old lore always used to make me think. "What would I do if something happened to my family." I have always felt, as most fathers do, that I would likely go on a spree like Gerald Butler in Law Abiding Citizen. Understanding that I am a little older than most here that people may think losing a spouse may cause this level of fury, but (maybe I am just a traditionalist) it is a father's sole responsibility to protect his children.  As Columbus says in Zombieland: "Take away a man's son, you've truly given him nothing left to lose. "

Second, As a Marine, I understand original lore Varus' tear between saving his family and fulfilling his duty. This brought me closer to him, there is no worse feeling on a "Soldiers" mind while deployed than not being there to protect and aide his or her family. I feel this way even now, although I am no longer on active duty my job requires me to travel around the country, and sometimes internationally. The thought that always crosses my mind is what if I am not there to save my wife and kids because of a job. 

These were the things people related to about Varus' lore.

However, I do like the new story and understand why they made the choice. Watching the behind the scenes, I feel like they wanted to go with this love conquers all vibe. I feel like this missed a chance for a human to overpower a darkin in will. Aatrox fell to the Darkin, Kayn battles with the darkin. Feels like they could have made Varus [Valmir doesn't make sense] (vengeful the darkin bow didn't save Kai) make the bow his bitch. It would be awesome to see a human have a will so strong that it could conquer a darkin.

ALL they had to do was write a story in which Varus bow awakens from slumber and starts talking. Darkin  would try to take full control of Varus but after seeing how strong his desire for vengeance is it makes a pact to let Varus have his power in exchange for Varus body later.

How they decided to merge 2 gays and one darkin into a new Varus is a joke. It makes no sense to what Varus was in his old lore.

Yeah, I don't know why Riot went this direction tbh.

They literally made a bunch more work for themselves AND created more inconsistencies (Why is Varus the Darkin? He doesn't have the same naming convention, as just one example.) 

I agree with you completely. A simple modernization would have been much better imo, and wouldn't destroy his character.

New full lore is now out. I'll break down the differences for you:

Differences:
- Varus is the name of the Darkin
- A Darkin was in the Pit of Pallas as opposed to some random gloppy stuff
- Three beings make up Varus: Valmar and Kai (hunters/hosts), and the darkin itself
- The three are struggling for control
- Valmar was gay for Kai, instead of having a wife and kids
- Valmar and Kai didn't live to guard the temple, instead they only happened to be there completing an old tradition.
- Varus has a sister (female Darkin maybe)
- They aim for different things: The Darkin aims to wake his kin, the hunters want to separate from Varus to live the rest of their lives together.

Same:
- Hosts are still Ionian
- Host's lover was still killed by Noxians
- The Pit of Pallas is still cannon (Pallas was retconned to the name of the city instead)
- Host still voluntarily accepted the being in the Pit for vengeance
- Still was an Archer
- Still defended the Temple when it was under attack.
- Still wears demon pants
- Still slaughtered Noxians out of vengeance after fusing.

I hope this goes to show that characters weren't thrown out, only made more cohesive with the rest of the world.

How was old Varus not thrown out?  The only elements from his old story made it in, and nothing of who he was as a person.

It was a fan theory for years that the Pit of Pallas had something to do with the Darkin, and everyone was expecting the new lore to specifically mention it, but to say the new lore is more "cohesive" when the only thing that ties it to the rest of the world that wasn't already in the old lore is the reveal that there are Darkin involved is just plain wrong.

Old Varus was thrown out, and we didn't gain a whole lot from it.
We gained a much better story for one.

It's more fleshed out, but I don't know if "better" is the right word.  Better is a purely subjective word, and as someone who does not enjoy love stories I thought the story of revenge in the old lore was better, even if it needed some work.

Well your correct, it is ultimately subjective, but from what I've seen on the boards and on reddit most people see this as a superior story.  I think a lot of people are tired of the archetypal lone figure seeking endless vengeance shtick that a lot of the champions run with.  I'm glad to see that Riot is diversifying.

The writing is superior, that much I'll give it, but I do hate to lose one of the parts of the old lore I actually thought was good.  I'd rather see this new direction show up as new champions, rather than come at the cost of more retconned lore.

While I didn't dislike the old lore Varus, I didn't think it was that special either.  We saw a broken man, lost his family and home, unleash a Dark power to defeat an Enemy.  In doing so this Dark Power begins slowly corrupting him.

New lore allows us to go a little further than the typical revenge story that most League of Legends characters are centered around.  We can see the struggle of what is the strongest of human emotions and tendencies.  Does the desire for revenge overpower love?  Are humans naturally inclined to be evil?  Are we monsters?  What makes us better than creatures like Varus if we commit even worse atrocities?

The darkin's lust for vengeance amplifies Val's, and it hopes to use that as a way to overwhelm the souls it used to make its flesh. Kai is the moral brake on that.

I mean, I'm all for being inclusive with LGBT characters, but why retcon an old champion rather than release a new LGBT champion that is LGBT from the start? 

Is Riot afraid they would see a dip in sales for new champions and skins for that champion because the champion is LGBT and retconning an old champ who already had already generated all of the revenue it could was safe and would also be a way to reach out to the LGBT community?

They've retconned most of the roster at this point. They retconned Ahri's species, and people weren't this mad about it. Even with as fervent and large as Ahri's fanbase is compared to Varus. 

You think all these posters here have a deep, abiding affection for Varus or his lore? Yeah, that's not what's happening here, friend.

Imagine Riot went with your idea and released Xayah and Rakan that both looked like Rakan. Tell me how well that would have gone.

I'm not sure I actually understand your point because it sounds like there are conflicting points... so if I'm misunderstanding you, please correct me.

Are you saying that if Xayah and Rakan were both male harpies, the release wouldn't have gone well and people wouldn't have purchased them?

I'm saying if they released Xayah and Rakan as gay characters, this board would have gone full Charlottesville.

I'm also saying that the boards reaction is out of proportion with Varus's actual popularity as seen here: https://public.tableau.com/profile/david.novati#!/vizhome/ClairvoyanceBlogSingle-NovaAsterix/SinglePatchClairvoyanceBlog

So I did understand you correctly.

I agree that there would be the uproar no matter what, but the thing is, releasing LGBT characters from the start is more of a progressive statement from a company and a way to stand up to bigotry and homophobia.

Retconning a champ that already has been released for 5 years and only giving his backstory a convoluted gay love story isn't the same for standing up to bigotry and homophobia. It feels like a very safe way to try and throw a bone to the LGBT community but not really at the same time because Varus technically isn't gay if you follow that Varus is the Darkin and Val and Kai are the two gay guys.

Retconning a 5 year old champ is very safe for them. Theyv'e already gotten the revenue from his release and his skins. It's been over a year since the last skin and people who spent money on him most likely already did... which makes it feel like a really cheap money grab from the LGBT demographic. They're going to try and get people to jump on the Varus train and spend money on skins because they probably don't have a shard.

I don't see this as really progressive even though I want it to be.

I agree that this change is unnecessary.  I mean, in his original lore the corruption within the pit was purposefully left vague, so they easily could have just taken their lore about the Darkin, and tacked that on the existing story.  If they really wanted the Darkin's name to be Varus that's fine. Just have the human in the original story have a different name, then after his family has died he does the classic 'My life as [human name] is over, now I am Varus.' kind of shtick. 

I personally find this new lore a lot worse than the old one. The whole gay for the sake of diversity thing does annoy me, but if they had taken the old lore, but instead of 'wife and child' had changed it to 'husband and child' I wouldn't have been nearly as annoyed. Mainly what frustrates me about it is that it's not two meaningless hunters with no real backstory that are the human characters. They don't even really exist anymore, so it's not like they can be interesting characters and experience development. The old lore at least had a human that mattered, and who still had partial control of his mind and  body, which meant he had chances to develop. What would happen after he got his revenge? How would he deal with his betrayed oaths? The power corrupting him? There was a ton of potential there to tell the story of the Darkin AND the Human, and to do so in a morally grey position.  Now though Varus is definitively evil, and has no human component that really matters, so he feels a lot more 1 dimensional.

What bothers me as a Varus player is that he now makes no sense, according to the lore there should be 3 beings struggling inside Varus to gain control - the darkin Varus and the 2 hunters have different goals yet share the same body - like kayn and rhaast, his lines now make 0 sense with who he's supposted to be (unless they'll give him a full new voice over which I doubt)
So meh, I wished they made a new darkin with a story similar to this one and kept Varus as that 1 guy that lost his family
I find it silly that a man can't be tragic if he loses his gay lover, that losing a wife and a child is somehow a better tragedy? Frankly, it does sound kind of homophobic, man.
His wife and children that were already part of his lore. How are losing loved ones not equal?
